codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the activity.
codelists.name: DDF Activity Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Activity Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The textual representation of the study activity.
The short descriptive designation for the study activity.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the clinical study activity.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the address.
codelists.name: DDF Address Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Address Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A standardized representation of the complete set of components denoting the physical address of the person, business, building, or organization.
The street name and number, building number, apartment or unit number, or post office box number where an entity is physically located.
A relatively large and/or densely populated area of human habitation with administrative or legal status that may be specified as a component of a postal address.
A sovereign nation occupying a distinct territory and ruled by an autonomous government.
An administrative or territorial division of a city, town, county, parish, state, country, or other locality based on a shared characteristic.
An alphanumeric code assigned to a mail delivery area.
A sub-division of a country that forms part of a federal union. States are usually, but not always, more autonomous than provinces and may have different laws from the central government.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the administration duration.
codelists.name: DDF Administration Duration Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Administration Duration Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the agent administration duration.
The value representing the amount of time over which the administration of an agent occurs.
The explanation for why the agent administration duration will vary within and/or across subjects.
terms.submissionValue: Administration Duration Reason Duration Will Vary

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the agent administration duration is planned to vary within and/or across subjects.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the agent administration.
codelists.name: DDF Agent Administration Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Agent Administration Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the agent administration.
The value representing the amount of an agent given to an individual at one time.
The short descriptive designation for the agent administration.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the agent administration.
The number of doses administered per a specific interval.
The way in which a pharmaceutical product is taken into, or makes contact with, the body. (CDISC Glossary)

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the analysis population.
codelists.name: DDF Analysis Population Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Analysis Population Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The textual representation of the study population for analysis.
The short descriptive designation for the analysis population.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the analysis population.
An instance of unstructured text that represents the analysis population.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the biomedical concept.
codelists.name: DDF Biomedical Concept Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Biomedical Concept Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A concept unique identifier assigned to a biomedical concept that points to the meaning of that biomedical concept.
The short descriptive designation for the biomedical concept.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the biomedical concept.
A citation to an authoritative source for a biomedical concept.
A word or an expression that serves as a figurative, symbolic, or exact substitute for a biomedical concept, and which has the same meaning.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the biomedical concept category.
codelists.name: DDF Biomedical Concept Category Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Biomedical Concept Category Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Biomedical Concept Category Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Biomedical Concept Category Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the biomedical concept category.
A narrative representation of the biomedical concept category.
The short descriptive designation for the biomedical concept category.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the biomedical concept category.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the biomedical concept property.
codelists.name: DDF Biomedical Concept Property Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Biomedical Concept Property Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Biomedical Concept Property Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Biomedical Concept Property Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A concept unique identifier assigned to a biomedical concept property that points to the meaning of that biomedical concept property.
An indication as to whether the biomedical concept property is activated for use within a given usage context for a biomedical concept.
The short descriptive designation for the biomedical concept property.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the biomedical concept property.
An indication as to whether the biomedical concept property is required.
The structural format of the biomedical concept property response value. The datatype is carried in the attribute and influences the set of allowable values the attribute may assume. (After HL7)
terms.preferredTerm: Biomedical Concept Property Response Data Type
terms.submissionValue: Biomedical Concept Property Response Data Type

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the biomedical concept surrogate.
codelists.name: DDF Biomedical Concept Surrogate Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Biomedical Concept Surrogate Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Biomedical Concept Surrogate Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Biomedical Concept Surrogate Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the biomedical concept surrogate.
The short descriptive designation for the biomedical concept surrogate.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the biomedical concept surrogate.
A citation to an authoritative source for a biomedical concept surrogate.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the characteristic.
codelists.name: DDF Characteristic Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Characteristic Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the characteristic.
The short descriptive designation for the characteristic.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the characteristic.
An instance of structured text that represents the characteristic.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the clinical study.
codelists.name: DDF Clinical Study Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Clinical Study Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The short descriptive designation for the clinical study.
A narrative representation of the study.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the code.
codelists.name: DDF Code Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Code Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the system used to assign and/or manage codes.
The version of the code system.
The literal value of a code.
Standardized or dictionary-derived human readable text associated with a code.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the condition assignment.
codelists.name: DDF Condition Assignment Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Condition Assignment Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: An assumption on which rests the validity or effect of something else.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the condition.
codelists.name: DDF Condition Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Condition Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the condition.
The short descriptive designation for the condition.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the condition.
An instance of structured text that represents the condition.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the eligibility criteria.
codelists.name: DDF Eligibility Criteria Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Eligibility Criteria Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A classification of the inclusion exclusion criterion.
A narrative representation of the study eligibility criterion.
A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the inclusion or exclusion criterion.
The short descriptive designation for the study eligibility criterion.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study eligibility criterion.
An instance of structured text that represents the study eligibility criterion.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the encounter.
codelists.name: DDF Encounter Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Encounter Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the protocol-defined clinical encounter.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) for a protocol-defined clinical encounter.
A characterization or classification of contact between subject/patient and healthcare practitioner/researcher, during which an assessment or activity is performed.
The means by which an interaction occurs between the subject/participant and person or entity (e.g., a device).
The environment/setting where the event, intervention, or finding occurred.
The short descriptive designation for the study encounter.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the endpoint.
codelists.name: DDF Endpoint Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Endpoint Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study endpoint.
The short descriptive designation for the study endpoint.
A characterization or classification of the study endpoint that determines its category of importance relative to other study endpoints.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study endpoint.
The reason or intention for the study endpoint.
An instance of structured text that represents the study endpoint.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the entities within the CDISC digital data flow (DDF) model.
codelists.name: DDF Entity Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Entities Terminology

terms.definition: A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization. (NCI)
The amount of time elapsed during the administration of an agent.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.
An alternative symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
A grouping of biomedical concepts based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
A characteristic from a set of characteristics used to define a biomedical concept.
A concept that substitutes for a standard biomedical concept from the designated source.

A unit of biomedical knowledge created from a unique combination of characteristics that include implementation details like variables and terminologies, used as building blocks for standardized, hierarchically structured clinical research information.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspects of an entity.
Contact between subject/patient and healthcare practitioner/researcher, during which an assessment or activity is performed. Contact may be physical or virtual.

A clinical study involves research using human volunteers (also called participants) that is intended to add to medical knowledge. There are two main types of clinical studies: clinical trials (also called interventional studies) and observational studies. [ClinicalTrials.gov] See also clinical trial. (CDISC Glossary)
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
An allotting or appointment to a set of conditions that are to be met in order to make a logical decision.
A state of being.
A health problem or disease that is identified as likely to be benefited by a therapy being studied in clinical trials.

A precise description of the treatment effect reflecting the clinical question posed by a given clinical trial objective. It summarises at a population level what the outcomes would be in the same patients under different treatment conditions being compared. (ICH E9 R1 Addendum)
The extent or range related to the physical location of an entity.

An event(s) occurring after treatment initiation that affects either the interpretation or the existence of the measurements associated with the clinical question of interest. (ICH E9 Addendum on Estimands)

The mechanism used to obscure the distinctive characteristics of the study intervention or procedure to make it indistinguishable from the comparator. NOTE: Blinding refers to study participants while masking refers to the study intervention. (CDISC Glossary)
The container that holds an instance of unstructured text and which may include objects such as tables, figures, and images.
A formalized group of persons or other organizations collected together for a common purpose (such as administrative, legal, political) and the infrastructure to carry out that purpose. (BRIDG)
The paired name and value for a given parameter.
A concise explanation of the meaning of a population.
Any activity performed by manual and/or instrumental means for the purpose of diagnosis, assessment, therapy, prevention, or palliative care.
How much there is of something that can be measured; the total amount or number.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

An organization that undertakes systematic investigation within a field of study in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, test a hypothesis, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.
A symbol or combination of symbols representing the response to the question.
To go out of or leave the schedule timeline.
A chronological schedule of planned temporal events.
A scheduled occurrence of an activity event.
A scheduled occurrence of a decision event.
A scheduled occurrence of a temporal event.
An action, undertaking, or event, which is anticipated to be performed or observed, or was performed or observed, according to the study protocol during the execution of the study.
The rationale for the change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a protocol.
A written description of a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a study.
A planned pathway assigned to the subject as they progress through the study, usually referred to by a name that reflects one or more treatments, exposures, and/or controls included in the path.
A group of individuals who share a set of characteristics (e.g., exposures, experiences, attributes), which logically defines a population under study.
A partitioning of a study arm into individual pieces, which are associated with an epoch and any number of sequential elements within that epoch.

A basic building block for time within a clinical study comprising the following characteristics: a description of what happens to the subject during the element; a definition of the start of the element; a rule for ending the element.
A strategy that specifies the structure of a study in terms of the planned activities (including timing) and statistical analysis approach intended to meet the objectives of the study.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

A defined variable intended to reflect an outcome of interest that is statistically analyzed to address a particular research question. NOTE: A precise definition of an endpoint typically specifies the type of assessments made, the timing of those assessments, the assessment tools used, and possibly other details, as applicable, such as how multiple assessments within an individual are to be combined. [After BEST Resource] (CDISC Glossary)
A named time period defined in the protocol, wherein a study activity is specified and unchanging throughout the interval, to support a study-specific purpose.
Any of the dates associated with event milestones within a clinical study's oversight and management framework.
A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the study.
The reason for performing a study in terms of the scientific questions to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
A representation of the study protocol (that persists over time) in document form.

A plan at a particular point in time for a formal investigation to assess the utility, impact, pharmacological, physiological, and/or psychological effects of a particular treatment, procedure, drug, device, biologic, food product, cosmetic, care plan, or subject characteristic. (BRIDG)
The location at which a study investigator conducts study activities.
The sponsor-defined name of the clinical study.
A plan at a particular point in time for a study.
The act of enrolling subjects into a study. The subject will have met the inclusion/exclusion criteria to participate in the trial and will have signed an informed consent form. (CDISC Glossary)
A reference source that provides a listing of valid parameter names and values used in syntax template text strings.
A standardized pattern used for the arrangement of words and phrases to create well-formed, structured sentences.

A target study population on which an analysis is performed. These may be represented by the entire study population, a subgroup defined by a particular characteristic measured at baseline, or a principal stratum defined by the occurrence (or non-occurrence, depending on context) of a specific intercurrent event. (ICH E9 R1 Addendum)
The group of people in the general population to which the study results can be generalized.
The chronological relationship between temporal events.
A guide that governs the allocation of subjects to operational options at a discrete decision point or branch (e.g., assignment to a particular arm, discontinuation) within a clinical trial plan.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the estimand.
codelists.name: DDF Estimand Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Estimand Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A synopsis of the clinical endpoint of interest within the analysis target study population.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the geographic scope.
codelists.name: DDF Geographic Scope Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Geographic Scope Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the geographic scope.
A characterization or classification of the geographic scope.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the governance date.
codelists.name: DDF Governance Date Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Governance Date Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A characterization or classification of the protocol approval date.
A narrative representation of the study governance date.
The short descriptive designation for the study governance date.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study governance date
The information contained in the date field.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the disease indication.
codelists.name: DDF Indication Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Indication Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the disease indication.
A narrative representation of the condition, disease or disorder that the clinical trial is intended to investigate or address.
An indication as to whether the disease/condition indication under study is considered a rare disease.
terms.preferredTerm: Disease Indication Is Rare Disease Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Disease/Condition Indication Is Rare Disease Indicator

terms.definition: The short descriptive designation for the disease/condition indication.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the disease/condition indication.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the intercurrent event.
codelists.name: DDF Intercurrent Event Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Intercurrent Event Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the intercurrent event.
The short descriptive designation for the intercurrent event.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the intercurrent event.
A textual description of the planned strategy to manage and/or mitigate intercurrent events.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the masking.
codelists.name: DDF Masking Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Masking Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study masking strategy, based on a person's role within the study.
An identifying designation assigned to a masked individual within a study that corresponds with their function.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the narrative content.
codelists.name: DDF Narrative Content Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Narrative Content Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the narrative content.
The numeric identifier assigned to a particular document section containing narrative content.
An identifying designation for the document section containing narrative content.
A textual representation of the narrative content.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the objective.
codelists.name: DDF Objective Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Objective Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study objective.
The short descriptive designation for the study objective.
A characterization or classification of the study objective that determines its category of importance relative to other study objectives.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study objective.
An instance of structured text that represents the study objective.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the organization.
codelists.name: DDF Organization Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Organization Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The name of the organization that provides the identifier for the entity.
A unique symbol that establishes identity of the organization. (BRIDG)
The short descriptive designation for the organization.
A non-unique textual identifier for the organization. (BRIDG)

A characterization or classification of the formalized group of persons or other organizations collected together for a common purpose (such as administrative, legal, political) and the infrastructure to carry out that purpose.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the parameter map.
codelists.name: DDF Parameter Map Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Parameter Map Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The reference for a tag used in programming languages, such as a markup language (e.g., HTML, XML), to store attributes and elements.
Character strings bounded by angle brackets that act as containers for programming language elements.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the population definition.
codelists.name: DDF Population Definition Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Population Definition Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the population definition.
An indication as to whether the population definition includes healthy subjects, that is, subjects without the disease or condition under study.
terms.preferredTerm: Population Definition Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Population Definition Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator

terms.definition: The short descriptive designation for the population definition.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the population definition.
The anticipated age of subjects within the population definition.
The value representing the planned number of subjects that must complete the study in order to meet the objectives and endpoints of the study, within the population definition.
The value representing the planned number of subjects to be entered in a clinical trial, within the population definition.
The protocol-defined sex within the population definition.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the procedure.
codelists.name: DDF Procedure Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Procedure Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to medical procedure.
A narrative representation of the procedure.
The short descriptive designation for the procedure.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the procedure.
A characterization or classification of the study procedure.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the quantity.
codelists.name: DDF Quantity Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Quantity Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The type of unit of measure being used to express a quantity.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the range.
codelists.name: DDF Range Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Range Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The largest value in quantity or degree in a set of values.
The smallest value in quantity or degree in a set of values.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
An indication as to whether the value range is almost, but not quite, exact.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the research organization.
codelists.name: DDF Research Organization Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Research Organization Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The name of the research organization that provides the identifier for the entity.

A characterization or classification of the formalized group of persons or other organizations collected together for a common purpose (such as administrative, legal, political) and the infrastructure to carry out that purpose.
A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the research organization.
The short descriptive designation for the research organization.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the research organization.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the response code.
codelists.name: DDF Response Code Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Response Code Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
An indication as to whether the response code is activated for use within a given usage context.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the schedule timeline.
codelists.name: DDF Schedule Timeline Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Schedule Timeline Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the timeline or timeline component is part of the central or principal timeline.
A narrative representation of the schedule timeline.
A logical evaluation on which rests the validity of entry into a schedule timeline.
The short descriptive designation for the schedule timeline.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the schedule timeline.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the scheduled activity instance.
codelists.name: DDF Scheduled Activity Instance Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Scheduled Activity Instance Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Scheduled Activity Instance Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Scheduled Activity Instance Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the scheduled activity instance.
The short descriptive designation for the scheduled activity instance.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the scheduled activity instance.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the scheduled decision instance.
codelists.name: DDF Scheduled Decision Instance Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Scheduled Decision Instance Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Scheduled Decision Instance Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Scheduled Decision Instance Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the scheduled Decision instance.
The short descriptive designation for the scheduled Decision instance.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the scheduled Decision instance.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the scheduled instance.
codelists.name: DDF Scheduled Instance Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Scheduled Instance Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the scheduled instance.
The short descriptive designation for the scheduled instance.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the scheduled instance.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study amendment.
codelists.name: DDF Study Amendment Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Amendment Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A string of numerals that uniquely identifies a protocol amendment.
An indication as to whether the amendment is likely to have a substantial impact on the safety or rights of study subjects/participants.
A short narrative representation describing the changes introduced in the current version of the protocol.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study amendment reason.
codelists.name: DDF Study Amendment Reason Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Amendment Reason Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Study Amendment Reason Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Study Amendment Reason Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The rationale for the change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a protocol that is not otherwise specified.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the study amendment reason.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study Arm.
codelists.name: DDF Study Arm Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Arm Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The textual representation of the study arm data origin.
A characterization or classification of the study arm with respect to where the study arm data originates.
A narrative representation of the study arm.
The short descriptive designation for the study arm.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study arm.
A characterization or classification of the study arm.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study cohort.
codelists.name: DDF Study Cohort Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Cohort Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study cohort.
An indication as to whether the study cohort includes healthy subjects, that is, subjects without the disease or condition under study.
terms.preferredTerm: Study Cohort Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Study Cohort Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator

terms.definition: The short descriptive designation for the study cohort.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study cohort.
The anticipated age of subjects within the study cohort.
The value representing the planned number of subjects that must complete the study in order to meet the objectives and endpoints of the study, within the study cohort.
The value representing the planned number of subjects to be entered in a clinical trial, within the study cohort.
The protocol-defined sex within the study cohort.
terms.preferredTerm: Planned Sex of Study Cohort Participants

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study design.
codelists.name: DDF Study Design Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Design Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The general design of the strategy for assigning interventions to participants in a clinical study. (clinicaltrials.gov)
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a study design.
A narrative representation of the study design.
The short descriptive designation for the study design.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study design.
A narrative representation of the study design population.
Reason(s) for choosing the study design. This may include reasons for the choice of control or comparator, as well as the scientific rationale for the study design.

A categorization of a disease, disorder, or other condition based on common characteristics and often associated with a medical specialty focusing on research and development of specific therapeutic interventions for the purpose of treatment and prevention.

The type of experimental design used to describe the level of awareness of the study subjects and/ or study personnel as it relates to the respective intervention(s) or assessments being observed, received or administered.
The planned purpose of the therapy, device, or agent under study in the clinical trial.
The nature of the interventional study for which information is being collected.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study design population.
codelists.name: DDF Study Design Population Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Design Population Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Study Design Population Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Study Design Population Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the study design population includes healthy subjects, that is, subjects without the disease or condition under study.
terms.preferredTerm: Study Design Population Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Study Design Population Includes Healthy Subjects Indicator

terms.definition: The short descriptive designation for the study design population.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study design population.
The anticipated age of subjects within the study design population.
The value representing the planned number of subjects that must complete the study in order to meet the objectives and endpoints of the study, within the study design population.
terms.preferredTerm: Study Design Population Planned Completion Number
terms.submissionValue: Study Design Population Planned Completion Number

terms.definition: The value representing the planned number of subjects to be entered in a clinical trial, within the study design population.
terms.preferredTerm: Study Design Population Planned Enrollment Number
terms.submissionValue: Study Design Population Planned Enrollment Number

terms.definition: The protocol-defined sex within the study design population.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study element.
codelists.name: DDF Study Element Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Element Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study design element.
The short descriptive designation for the study design element.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study design element.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study epoch.
codelists.name: DDF Study Epoch Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Epoch Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study epoch.
The short descriptive designation for the study epoch.

The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study epoch, i.e., the named time period defined in the protocol, wherein a study activity is specified and unchanging throughout the interval, to support a study-specific purpose.

A characterization or classification of the study epoch, i.e., the named time period defined in the protocol, wherein a study activity is specified and unchanging throughout the interval, to support a study-specific purpose.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study identifier.
codelists.name: DDF Study Identifier Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Identifier Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the study.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study interventions.
codelists.name: DDF Study Intervention Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Intervention Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: The pharmacological class of the investigational product.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the study intervention.
A narrative representation of the study intervention.
The short descriptive designation for the study intervention.
The value representing the minimum amount of time required to meet the criteria for response to study intervention.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study intervention.
An indication as to whether the investigational intervention is an investigational medicinal product or an auxiliary medicinal product.
The intended use of the trial intervention within the context of the study design.
The kind of product or procedure studied in a trial.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study protocol document.
codelists.name: DDF Study Protocol Document Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Protocol Document Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Study Protocol Document Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Study Protocol Document Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study protocol document.
The short descriptive designation for the study protocol document.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study protocol document.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study site.
codelists.name: DDF Study Site Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Site Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the study site.
The short descriptive designation for the study site.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the study site.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study title.
codelists.name: DDF Study Title Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Title Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: An instance of unstructured text that represents the study title.
A characterization or classification of the study title.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the study version.
codelists.name: DDF Study Version Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Version Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A therapeutic area classification based on the structure and operations of the business unit.

A statement describing the overall rationale of the study. This field describes the contribution of this study to product development, i.e., what knowledge is being contributed from the conduct of this study.
The nature of the investigation for which study information is being collected. (After clinicaltrials.gov)
A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize the study version.

A step in the clinical research and development of a therapy from initial clinical trials to post-approval studies. NOTE: Clinical trials are generally categorized into four (sometimes five) phases. A therapeutic intervention may be evaluated in two or more phases simultaneously in different trials, and some trials may overlap two different phases. [21 CFR section 312.21; After ICH Topic E8 NOTE FOR GUIDANCE ON GENERAL CONSIDERATIONS FOR CLINICAL TRIALS, CPMP/ICH/291/95 March 1998]

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the subject enrollment.
codelists.name: DDF Subject Enrollment Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Subject Enrollment Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the subject enrollment.
The value representing the number of individuals enrolled in a study.
A characterization or classification of the subject enrollment.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the syntax template.
codelists.name: DDF Syntax Template Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Syntax Template Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the syntax template.
The short descriptive designation for the syntax template.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the syntax template.
A structured text string containing prescribed text interspersed with user-defined parameter values.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the syntax template dictionary.
codelists.name: DDF Syntax Template Dictionary Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Syntax Template Dictionary Attribute Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: DDF Syntax Template Dictionary Attribute Terminology
synonyms: DDF Syntax Template Dictionary Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the syntax template dictionary.
The short descriptive designation for the syntax template dictionary.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the syntax template dictionary.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the timing.
codelists.name: DDF Timing Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Timing Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the biomedical concept category.
The short descriptive designation for the timing.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the timing.
The name of the reference event used to define the temporal relationship with another event.
A characterization or classification of the chronological relationship between temporal events.
The short descriptive designation for the timing value.
The temporal value of the chronological relationship between temporal events.
The short descriptive designation for a time period, or other type of interval, during which a temporal event may be achieved, obtained, or observed.
The earliest chronological value of an allowable period of time during which a temporal event takes place.
The latest chronological value of an allowable period of time during which a temporal event takes place.

codelists.definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the transition rule.
codelists.name: DDF Transition Rule Attribute Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Transition Rule Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A narrative representation of the transition rule.
The short descriptive designation for the transition rule.
The literal identifier (i.e., distinctive designation) of the transition rule.
An instance of unstructured text that represents the transition rule.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the encounter type.
codelists.name: Encounter Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Encounter Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the endpoint level.
codelists.name: Endpoint Level Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Endpoint Level Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: Endpoint(s) that may include clinically important events that are expected to occur too infrequently to show a treatment effect or endpoints that for other reasons are thought to be less likely to show an effect but are included to explore new hypotheses. (After FDA-NIH Protocol Template)

Endpoint(s) of greatest importance that is the basis for concluding whether the study met its objective(s) and provides a clinically relevant, valid, and reliable measure of the primary objective(s). (After FDA-NIH Protocol Template)

Endpoint(s) that may provide supportive information about the effect of the study intervention(s) on the primary endpoint or demonstrate additional effects on the disease or condition. (After FDA-NIH Protocol Template)

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the geographic scope type value set.
codelists.name: Geographic Scope Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Geographic Scope Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Geographic Scope Type Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Geographic Scope Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A sovereign nation occupying a distinct territory and ruled by an autonomous government.
Covering or affecting the whole of a system.
An area or portion of something with more or less definite boundaries designed or specified according to some established criteria.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the governance date type value set.
codelists.name: Governance Date Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Governance Date Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Governance Date Type Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Governance Date Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: The date and time specifying when the protocol takes effect or becomes operative.
The date on which a version of the protocol was finalized or approved by the sponsor.
synonyms: Protocol Amendment Approval by Sponsor Date

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the masking role value set.
codelists.name: Masking Role Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Masking Role Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional. (NCI)
A person responsible for the conduct of the study, ensuring adherence to the protocol and good clinical practices. (CDISC Glossary)
The individual who evaluates the outcome(s) of interest. (Clinicaltrials.gov)

An individual, company, institution, or organization that takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. [After ICH E6, WHO, 21 CFR 50.3 (e), and after IDMP]
An individual who is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the objective level.
codelists.name: Objective Level Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Objective Level Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: Additional scientific question(s) within the study that enable further discovery research, beyond the primary and secondary objectives.
The main scientific question(s) the study is designed to answer. (CDISC Glossary)
The supportive or ancillary scientific question(s) the study is designed to answer. (CDISC Glossary)

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the organization type.
codelists.name: Organization Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Organization Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: An organization (typically a government agency) that administers the registration of studies. (BRIDG)

An individual, company, institution, or organization that takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. [After ICH E6, WHO, 21 CFR 50.3 (e), and after IDMP]

An organization (typically a government agency) that is responsible for implementing and enforcing laws, licensing and regulating products and services, promoting the use of standards, and ensuring safety and consumer protections.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the protocol status.
codelists.name: Protocol Status Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Protocol Status Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
A preliminary version of a written work, design, or picture.
Conclusive in a process or progression.
No longer in use or valid; old.
A preliminary version of a written work, design, or picture that is awaiting review.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study amendment reason code value set.
codelists.name: Study Amendment Reason Code Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Amendment Reason Code Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Amendment Reason Code Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Amendment Reason Code Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A change in the standard of care necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
A change in the study purpose or intent of the scientific plan necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
The addition of an investigational medicinal product to a clinical trial design necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
An error or inconsistency in the protocol necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
terms.preferredTerm: Inconsistency and/or Error In The Protocol
terms.submissionValue: Inconsistency And/or Error In The Protocol

terms.definition: Feedback from the investigator or study site necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
Feedback from the institutional review board or independent ethics committee necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
A change to manufacturing processes of the study agents necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
Previously unavailable data (other than safety data) becomes available, which necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
terms.preferredTerm: New Data Available (Other Than Safety Data)
terms.submissionValue: New Data Available (Other Than Safety Data)

terms.definition: A regulatory agency has published a guidance document that necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
Previously unavailable safety data becomes available, which necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
A protocol design error necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a document. (ICH M11)
Challenges with participant recruitment necessitates a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)
A regulatory agency has expressed a need for a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, the protocol. (ICH M11)

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study arm data origin type.
codelists.name: Study Arm Data Origin Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Arm Data Origin Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Arm Data Origin Type Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Arm Data Origin Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: Data that are generated from the current study.
Data from studies that have occurred in the past.

Data relating to patient health status and/or the delivery of health care routinely collected from sources other than traditional clinical trials. NOTE: Examples of sources include data derived from electronic health records (EHRs); medical claims and billing data; data from product and disease registries; patient-generated data, including from in-home-use settings; and data gathered from other sources that can inform on health status, such as mobile devices. [After 21 U.S.C. 355g(b)).5 and Framework for FDA's Real-World Evidence Program December 2018] See also Real-World Evidence (RWE)

Data that are artificially created rather than being generated by actual events. NOTE: Data are often created with the help of algorithms and used for a wide range of activities, including as test data for new products and tools, for model validation, and in AI optimization. [After The Ultimate Guide to Synthetic Data in 2020, August 29, 2020]. See also artificial intelligence.
Data that are generated from virtual encounters between investigators and subjects.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study design characteristics value set.
codelists.name: Study Design Characteristics Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Design Characteristics Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Design Characteristics Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Design Characteristics Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A study design that allows for prospectively planned modifications to one or more aspects of the design based on accumulating data from subjects in the trial. (FDA)
A study design in which subjects enrolled in one study are subsequently continued into a related study for longer term safety, tolerability, and/or effectiveness monitoring.
A study design in which interventions are assigned to subjects according to randomization principles.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study intervention product designation value set.
codelists.name: Study Intervention Product Designation Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Intervention Product Designation Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Intervention Product Designation Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Intervention Product Designation Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A medicinal product which is being tested or used as a reference, including as a placebo, in a clinical trial. (Regulation (EU) No 536/2014 Article 2 (5))

A medicinal product that is related to the specific needs of the clinical trial as described in the protocol, but not as an investigational medicinal product. NOTE: Auxiliary medicinal products may be authorised for marketing in a country or region or non-authorised. (CDISC Glossary)

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study intervention role value set.
codelists.name: Study Intervention Role Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Intervention Role Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Intervention Role Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Intervention Role Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A medicinal product that must be administered along with the experimental treatment (e.g., drug studies wherein opioid blockers are administered to prevent overdose).

Medicinal products that are administered to each clinical trial subject, regardless of randomization group, a) to treat the indication which is the object of the study, or b) required in the protocol as part of standard care for a condition that is not the indication under investigation, and is relevant for the clinical trial design. [After Recommendations from the expert group on clinical trials for the implementation of Regulation (EU) No 536/2014' dd 28 June 2017]

A non-investigational medicinal product (NIMP) given to trial subjects to produce a physiological response that is necessary before the pharmacological action of the investigational medicinal product can be assessed. [After Recommendations from the expert group on clinical trials for the implementation of Regulation (EU) No 536/2014' dd 28 June 2017]
Any procedure or test used to diagnose a disease or disorder.

The drug, device, therapy, procedure, or process under investigation in a clinical study that is believed to have an effect on outcomes of interest in a study (e.g., health-related quality of life, efficacy, safety, pharmacoeconomics). [After https://grants.nih.gov/grants/policy/faq_clinical_trial_definition.htm#5224; https://grants.nih.gov/policy/clinical-trials/protocol-template.htm] See also test articles, devices, drug product, combination product, treatment, diagnosis. Contrast with investigational medicinal product.
A pharmaceutical preparation that does not contain the investigational agent and is generally prepared to be physically indistinguishable from the preparation containing the investigational product.

Medicinal products identified in the protocol as those that may be administered to subjects when the efficacy of the investigational medicinal product (IMP) is not satisfactory, the effect of the IMP is too great and is likely to cause a hazard to the patient, or to manage an emergency situation. [After EU-CTR Recommendations from the expert group on clinical trials for the implementation of Regulation (EU) No 536/2014' dd 28 June 2017]

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the study title type value set.
codelists.name: Study Title Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Study Title Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Study Title Type Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Study Title Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: The short descriptive name for the study.
The formal descriptive name for the study.
The descriptive name of the study that is intended for the lay public, written in easily understood language.
A more extensive descriptive name of the study that is intended for medical professionals, written using medical and scientific language.
A word or words formed from the beginning letters or a combination of syllables and letters of a compound term, which identifies a clinical study.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the timing relative to from value set.
codelists.name: Timing Relative To From Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Timing Relative To From Value Set Terminology
codelists.submissionValue: Timing Relative To From Value Set Terminology
synonyms: Timing Relative To From Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A timing relationship defined as the end of one event to the end of another event.
A timing relationship defined as the end of one event to the start of another event.
A timing relationship defined as the start of one event to the end of another event.
A timing relationship defined as the start of one event to the start of another event.

codelists.definition: The terminology relevant to the timing type value set.
codelists.name: Timing Type Value Set Terminology
codelists.preferredTerm: CDISC DDF Timing Type Value Set Terminology

terms.definition: A type of time point relationship that follows a point or period of time within a timeline.
A type of time point relationship that comes before a point or period of time within a timeline.
A type of time point relationship that is fixed with respect to a timeline.

description: CDISC Controlled Terminology for DDF is the set of CDISC-developed or CDISC-adopted standard expressions (values) used with data items within CDISC-defined DDF datasets.
label: DDF Controlled Terminology Package 58 Effective 2024-09-27
name: DDF CT 2024-09-27
source: DDF Controlled Terminology developed by the CDISC Terminology Team in collaboration with the National Cancer Institute's Enterprise Vocabulary Services (EVS)
